events.name: Getting Started With 3D Printing
events.description:
So what exactly is 3D printing? In this talk, 2 speakers share one application — the idea that, now people could design and print their own 3D products. They will bring their first 3D printer, tour us through the possibilities of 3D printing and learn their journey on how they got started with the whole 3D printing process. There will be demos as well as samples of items that they have 3D printed.
This session is for all who have heard of 3D printing or seen 3D printing and thinking of trying out yourselves. There will also be a Q&A session after the talk.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-jan-meeting-2016-tickets-20411008877

events.name: Book Club: Seven Languages in Seven Weeks – Ruby
events.description:
Read Seven Languages in Seven Weeks. This week we'll be covering the chapters on Ruby.  


"Just as each new spoken language can make you smarter and increase your options, each programming language increases your mental tool kit, adding new abstractions you can throw at each new problem. " How Book Club Works1. Read the chapter before you come to the meetup.2. Find something in the chapter you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting.4. Group discussion and banter ensues! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Bring snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Plan, develop, test & release to Azure using Visual Studio Team Services
events.description:
Hi all! To start off the new year, I'm happy to announce that as part of this user group's collaboration with JetBrains, we will be giving out 1 free personal license of ReSharper by means of a lucky draw. All you need to do to participate is to drop your business card and we'll draw a winner at the end of the meetup. 


Now onto the agenda, we are going to look at how we can complete a full "plan develop test release" cycle using Visual Studio Team Services(formerly Visual Studio Online). We will go through how to: 1) Plan a project using a product backlog 2) Create and deploy (through release management) a website to Azure  3) Harness the power of the cloud and use Azure to load test your application 4) Monitor the availability and responsiveness of your site with Application Insights 


Wi-Fi: Free  Food: Available, starts at 6.45pm
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard
events.group_name: Visual Studio ALM and TFS Singapore
